text: Seventh Sunday of Easter Ascension Sunday May 29 2022 This weekend our nation observes Memorial Day On this day we thank God and pray for those who have made the ultimate sacrifice to defend our country's freedom Join us for Mass this Memorial Day Monday May 30th at 9 AM This weekend the Church celebrates the Solemnity of the Ascension This celebration is meant to mark the fortieth day since Easter Sunday and points us toward Pentecost Though our Lord Jesus has ascended to the right hand of the Father He has not abandoned us On Pentecost the Lord sends forth the Holy Spirit to renew the face of the earth vivify His Church and remain ever with us For our Parish Family and Mass in the Summer Each weekend one of our repeated Mass intentions is offered for our Parish Family This summer however you will notice that this intention will generally not be listed among our weekend intentions That is because as I travel for the summer this intention travels with me This intention is formally known as the Pro Populo Mass or the Mass for the People As pastor of St Joseph I have the responsibility under Church law Canon 534 1 to offer a Mass for the people of our parish every Sunday and Holy Day of Obligation As the Catechism states the Mass is the highest form of prayer that we can offer Catechism Para 1324 How appropriate it is then that the pastor frequently offers the Mass on behalf of those entrusted to his care Though I will be away from the parish for the summer I remain the pastor of our parish and I retain this great responsibility to offer Mass on your behalf This means that every Sunday wherever I might be I will offer the Pro Populo Mass for our parish family As priests are also strongly encouraged to and I personally believe should offer Mass everyday I will offer my weekday Masses throughout this summer for many special intentions that I have been asked by others to pray for Entering into the summer months it is important to remember that our attendance at Sunday Mass remains just as important during this time as at any other time throughout the year If you are traveling any weekend this summer you can find Mass times at www.Masstimes.org for churches throughout the world Ensuring that we attend Mass most especially when traveling on vacation serves as a beautiful witness to how important the Mass is It also allows us to experience the universality of the Church seeing our Faith lived in various places Visiting Priests and Summer Coverage As I leave this week for the Catholic University of America in Washington DC we will welcome a number of priests to assist with Masses over the next three weekends For daily Masses priests from Decatur Fort Wayne will be providing coverage each day On Saturday June 4th we will welcome Msgr Michael Heintz Academic Dean of Mt St Mary's Seminary in Emmitsburg MD for our Vigil Mass On Sunday June 5th Fr Stephen Felicichia parochial vicar at St Elizabeth Ann Seton will preside at our morning Masses The following week end we will welcome Fr Bill Sullivan as the presider for our weekend Masses On June 18th we will welcome Fr John Sheehan SJ who will be in residence at the rectory for the remainder of the summer Fr Sheehan a priest of the Society of Jesus or Jesuits currently serves as the chaplain at the University of St Francis in Fort Wayne Prior to this he has had a wealth of experience serving as a missionary for 12 years in Nigeria 27 months in the South Pacific and most recently three years in Amman Jordan Before entering the Jesuits he worked in professional theatre and broadcasting As always I thank you for the warm welcome you will give to our visiting priests throughout the summer Over the next two months I will be fairly focused on my studies especially with the approaching oral comprehensive exam at the end of the summer This means that I will not be regularly checking my office voicemail or parish email during the summer If you need to reach me please contact the Parish Office Let us always keep each other in prayer and I look forward to being back at St Joseph's in August Our Bulletin Cover is taken from my ordination at St Matthew Co Cathedral on June 4 2016 This coming Saturday Bishop Rhoades will ordain three men as priests for our diocese at the Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception at 11 AM in Fort Wayne All are welcome to attend MASS Death To New Life In your charity please pray for the repose of the soul of Lugene Keys husband of Dr Kay Johnson Keys who passed away Sunday May 22 2022 and will be laid to rest on Wednesday June 1 2022 May God welcome Lugene home fill him with peace and bless those who will miss him Eternal Rest Grant unto him Lord and let Perpetual light shine upon him May his soul and the souls of all the faithful departed through the mercy of God rest in Peace Amen FIRST FRIDAY ADORATION Friday June 3 2022 Adoration begins following the 8:30am Mass Confessions 500 5:45pm Benediction at 5:45pm Mass at 6:00pm Ad orientum Could you not keep watch with me for one hour Matt 2640 Please sign up on the sheet in the narthex FIRST SATURDAY CONFESSION Saturday June 4 2022 following 8:00am Mass The Totus Tuus Grade School Program is designed for children entering Grade 1 through Grade 6 in the 2022 23 school year The Grade School Program runs Monday June 13 Friday June 17 from 9:00am to 2:30pm The Totus Tuus Junior High High School Program is for young people who will be entering Junior High Grade 7 through those who have just graduated high school The Junior High and High School program meets Sunday June 12 through Thursday June 16 from 7:00pm to 9:00pm Registration packets are available in the narthex No cost to attend Please return forms on or before May 31 2022 SPIRITUAL PILGRIMAGE Join us on a Spiritual Pilgrimage to the Solanus Casey Center in Detroit The bus will depart fromboth SS Peter Paul Parish in Huntington and from St Elizabeth Ann Seton Parish in Fort Wayne on June 15 2022 See the bulletin board in the narthex for further details RED CROSS BLOOD DRIVE Our Knights of Columbus will host an American Red Cross Blood Drive Sunday June 26th 7:30am to 12:30pm To donate please
